fields.listHeading: Here are some recommended steps for storing cement bags:

list.heading: Elevate the storage area
list.description: Keep the storage area elevated from the ground to prevent moisture from seeping in.

list.heading: Stack bags properly
list.description: Stack the cement bags on pallets or wooden platforms to prevent damage and allow air to circulate around them. Do not stack bags too high, as this could pose a safety hazard.

list.heading: Protect from weather
list.description: Store the bags under a roof or covered area to protect them from direct exposure to weather.

list.heading: Avoid moisture
list.description: Make sure the storage area is well-ventilated to prevent moisture build-up. If possible, install a dehumidifier to further reduce moisture levels.

list.heading: Rotate stock
list.description: Regularly rotate the stock, using the oldest bags first, to avoid spoilage.

list.heading: Maintain cleanliness
list.description: Keep the storage area clean and free from any materials that can cause contamination, such as oil, grease, or chemicals.

list.heading: Label bags
list.description: Label the bags with the date of manufacture and expiry to keep track of their age and prevent using outdated bags.
